notes.features: Human Features: • One extra skill proficiency of your choosing • One bonus feat of your choosing Noble Feature: • You can secure an audience with a local noble Class Features: • Heal 1d10 + level hit points as a bonus action (once between rests) • Fighting Style - Archery: +2 to attack with ranged weapons • Dual Wielder: You can draw/stow two weapons per round, you can dual wield non-light weapons, and you gain +1 AC while dual wielding • Gain advantage on survival and Int checks concerning your chosen creature type, and you know a language spoken by those creatures • Gain advantage on Wis and Int checks concerning your chosen terrain, and bonuses while traveling through that terrain (see rules) • Take an extra action once between rests • Fighter Archetype: Champion • Crit on 19 • You can sacrifice a spell slot as an action to determine if certain creature types are within 1 mile (6 miles if favored terrain) (see rules) • Big Game Hunter - You can use a reaction to attack a creature of at least Large size that attacks you
notes.armor-proficiencies: Light Armor, Medium Armor, Heavy Armor, Shields
notes.weapon-proficiencies: Simple Weapons, Martial Weapons
notes.special-items: One type of gaming set
notes.languages: Common Extra Language One Extra Language
notes.equiptment: martial weapon shield light crossbow + 20 bolts OR two hand axes dungeoneer's pack OR explorer's pack set of fine clothes signet ring scroll of pedigree purse chain mail

notes.features: Elf Features: • Within 60 feet of you, treat dim light as bright, darkness as dim light • Immune to magical sleep, advantage on saves vs charmed • Meditating 4 hours counts as 8 hours of rest • Perception proficiency • Can hide while lightly obscured by natural phenomena • Longsword, shortsword, shortbow, longbow proficiency Noble Feature: • You can secure an audience with a local noble Class Features: • Understand a secret druid language • You can shapeshift into the form of a beast as an action (see rules) • Druid Archetype: Land • You know an extra druid cantrip • Regain half your level worth of spell slots during a short rest (once per day) • Forest - Gain bonus known spells • You are unaffected by nonmagical difficult terrain or plants and gain advantage vs magical plants that effect movement • War Caster: You gain advantage on concentration vs damage, can still cast while holding weapons, and can cast a single target 1 action spell as an opportunity attack • You are immune to poison and disease, and to effects by elementals or fey that frighten or charm
notes.armor-proficiencies: Light Armor, Medium Armor, Shields
notes.weapon-proficiencies: Longswords, Shortswords, Shortbows, Longbows Clubs, Daggers, Darts, Javelins, Maces, Quarterstaffs, Scimitars, Sickles, Slings, Spears
notes.special-items: Herbalism Kit One type of gaming set
notes.languages: Common, Elvish Druidic One Extra Language
notes.equiptment: wooden shield OR simple weapon scimitar OR simple melee weapon leather armor explorer's pack druidic focus set of fine clothes signet ring scroll of pedigree purse

notes.features: Tiefling Features: • Within 60 feet of you, treat dim light as bright, darkness as dim light • Gain fire resistance • Can cast the thaumaturgy cantrip. At 3rd level, hellish rebuke (1/day). At 5th level, darkness (1/day) (use Cha for DCs) Criminal Feature: • You know someone who can connect you with other criminals Fighter Features: • Fighting Style - Dueling: +2 damage when using a single one-handed weapon • Heal 1d10 + level hit points as a bonus action (once between rests) • Take an extra action once between rests Rogue Features: • Double proficiency with chosen skills • Sneak Attack (2d6) • Understand a secret language • Double proficiency with chosen skills (Deception,Intimidation) • Fighter Archetype: Eldritch Knight • Form a magical bond with a weapon (see rules) • You can dash, disengage, or hide as a bonus action • Alert: You don't grant advantage vs hidden creatures, you are never surprised, and you gain +5 to initiative • Rogue Archetype: Assassin • You are proficient with poisoner's kits and disguise kits • You always crit surprised creatures and you have advantage vs creatures who haven't acted • You can make two attacks on your turn
notes.armor-proficiencies: Light Armor, Medium Armor, Heavy Armor, Shields Light Armor
notes.weapon-proficiencies: Simple Weapons, Martial Weapons
notes.special-items: One type of gaming set Thieves' Tools Thieves' Tools Disguise kit Poisoner's kit
notes.languages: Common Infernal Thieves' Cant
notes.equiptment:
chain mail rapier martial weapon handaxe (2) dungeoneer's pack crowbar set of dark common clothes hood belt pouch
circlet of blasting - cast scorching ray w/ +5 to attack once per day ring of spell storing - holds 5 levels of spells: Dimension Door, Arms Of Hadar

notes.features: Human Features: • One extra skill proficiency of your choosing • One bonus feat of your choosing Noble Feature: • You can secure an audience with a local noble Fighter Features: • Fighting Style - Great Weapon Fighting: Reroll 1's and 2's on two-handed melee weapon damage dice • Heal 1d10 + level hit points as a bonus action (once between rests) • Tavern Brawler: Your unarmed strikes deal d4 damage, you are proficient in unarmed strikes and improvised weapons, can make a grapple as a bonus action after hitting with one, and +1 to either Str or Con Monk Features: • Add Wis mod to AC when not wearing armor or using a shield • When unarmed or using monk weapons, can use dex for attack and damage rolls, unarmed strikes deal more damage (d4), and can make an unarmed attack as a bonus action after normal attack action • You gain a reservoir of energy (ki points = monk level) which is restored during a rest • You can use a bonus action and spend 1 ki point to make two unarmed strikes right after using the attack action • You can use a bonus action and spend 1 ki point to Dodge • You can use a bonus action and spend 1 ki point to Dash or Disengage and double the distance you can jump • When you are not in armor or using a shield your speed improves by 10 feet • When you are hit by a ranged weapon attack you can use a reaction to reduce the damage by 1d10 + Dex mod + Monk level, and you can catch and throw the weapon if you would take 0 damage (see rules) • Monk Archetype: Hand • When you hit a creature with a Flurry of Blows attack you can inflict an additional effect (see rules) • Take an extra action once between rests • Fighter Archetype: Knight • Three allies within 60ft heal your level in hp when you second wind • Mounted Combatant: You can redirect an attack against your mount to yourself, you gain advantage vs unmounted foes, and your mount gains Evasion
notes.armor-proficiencies: Light Armor, Medium Armor, Heavy Armor, Shields Light Armor, Shortswords
notes.weapon-proficiencies: Simple Weapons, Martial Weapons Improvised Weapons Unarmed Strikes
notes.special-items: One type of gaming set
notes.languages: Common Extra Language One Extra Language
notes.equiptment: chain mail longsword greatsword handaxe (2) explorer's pack set of fine clothes signet ring scroll of pedigree purse

notes.features: Elf Features: • Within 60 feet of you, treat dim light as bright, darkness as dim light • Immune to magical sleep, advantage on saves vs charmed • Meditating 4 hours counts as 8 hours of rest • Perception proficiency • Longsword, shortsword, shortbow, longbow proficiency • Gain 1 wizard cantrip Cloistered Scholar Feature: • You have information about your cloister and you can use its library. Other libraries are also more likely to admit you. Paladin Features: • As an action, detect the location of any celestial, fiend or undead and any consecrated or desecrated place or object within 60 feet (1 + Cha mod per day) • Gain a reservoir of healing power (25hp), and as an action, you can heal a creature you touch by draining that power. You can also cure one poison or disease from the creature by sacrificing 5hp from the reservoir • Fighting Style - Dueling: +2 damage when using a single one-handed weapon • You can sacrifice a spell slot to deal (1 + spell level)d8 radiant damage plus 1d8 extra damage vs undead/fiends, when you hit with a melee weapon attack • Gain immunity to disease • Paladin Archetype: Crown • Champion Challenge (see rules) • Turn the Tide (see rules) • Dual Wielder: You can draw/stow two weapons per round, you can dual wield non-light weapons, and you gain +1 AC while dual wielding • You can make two attacks on your turn
notes.armor-proficiencies: Light Armor, Medium Armor, Heavy Armor, Shields
notes.weapon-proficiencies: Longsword Shortsword Shortbow Longbow Simple Weapons, Martial Weapons
notes.languages: Common Elvish Extra Language Two Extra Languages
notes.equiptment: chain mail rapier rapier dagger priest's pack holy symbol scholar's robes writing kit research book (borrowed) pouch

notes.features: Goliath Features: • Athletics proficiency • As a reaction, you can reduce damage you would take by 1d12 + Con (1/rest) • You can lift, drag, push, and carry weight as if one size larger • You are adapted to cold climates and high altitudes (see rules) Criminal Feature: • You know someone who can connect you with other criminals Monk Features: • Add Wis mod to AC when not wearing armor or using a shield • When unarmed or using monk weapons, can use dex for attack and damage rolls, unarmed strikes deal more damage (d4), and can make an unarmed attack as a bonus action after normal attack action • You gain a reservoir of energy (ki points = monk level) which is restored during a rest • You can use a bonus action and spend 1 ki point to make two unarmed strikes right after using the attack action • You can use a bonus action and spend 1 ki point to Dodge • You can use a bonus action and spend 1 ki point to Dash or Disengage and double the distance you can jump • When you are not in armor or using a shield your speed improves by 10 feet • When you are hit by a ranged weapon attack you can use a reaction to reduce the damage by 1d10 + Dex mod + Monk level, and you can catch and throw the weapon if you would take 0 damage (see rules) • Monk Archetype: Death • Gain Wis mod + monk level temp hp when you down an adjacent foe • You can use a reaction to reduce fall damage by 5 x Monk level • Tavern Brawler: Your unarmed strikes deal d4 damage, you are proficient in unarmed strikes and improvised weapons, can make a grapple as a bonus action after hitting with one, and +1 to either Str or Con • You can make two attacks on your turn • You can spend 1 ki point when you hit a creature with a melee attack to force it to make a Con save or be stunned for a round
notes.weapon-proficiencies: Simple Weapons, Shortswords Improvised Weapons Unarmed Strikes
notes.special-items: One type of gaming set Thieves' Tools One type of artisan's tools OR one musical instrument
notes.equiptment:
greatclub dart (10) unarmed strike dungeoneer's pack crowbar set of dark common clothes hood belt pouch
wand of the web - 7 charges / use 1 to cast web

notes.features: Elf Features: • Within 120 feet of you, treat dim light as bright, darkness as dim light • Immune to magical sleep, advantage on saves vs charmed • Meditating 4 hours counts as 8 hours of rest • Perception proficiency • While in direct sunlight, you have disadvantage on attack rolls and perception checks • Can cast the dancing lights cantrip. At 3rd level, faerie fire (1/day). At 5th level, darkness (1/day) (use Cha for DCs) • Rapier, shortsword, and hand crossbow proficiency Folk Hero Feature: • Commoners are willing to shelter you from some troubles Rogue Features: • Double proficiency with chosen skills • Sneak Attack (4d6) • Understand a secret language • Double proficiency with chosen skills/tools (Stealth,Thieves' Tools) • You can dash, disengage, or hide as a bonus action • Rogue Archetype: Assassin • You are proficient with poisoner's kits and disguise kits • You always crit surprised creatures and you have advantage vs creatures who haven't acted • Magic Initiate: You gain two cantrips and a first level spell which you can cast 1/day from a single spellcasting class • You can use a reaction to take half damage when hit by a foe that you see • Double proficiency with chosen skills (Investigation,Sleight of Hand) • When you would make a Dex save for half damage, you take no damage if you pass or half damage if you do not • Sharpshooter: Your ranged attacks ignore ½ and ¾ cover, don't have disadvantage from long range, and you can take -5 to a ranged attack for +10 damage
notes.armor-proficiencies: Light Armor
notes.weapon-proficiencies: Rapier Shortsword Hand Crossbow Simple Weapons, Hand Crossbows, Longswords, Rapiers, Shortswords
notes.special-items: One type of artisan's tools Vehicles (land) Thieves' Tools Disguise kit Poisoner's kit
notes.languages: Common Elvish Extra Language Thieves' Cant

notes.features: Dragonborn Features: • Silver Dragon • You can breathe a 15 ft cone of Cold(once between rests), dealing 3d6 Cold damage, Con save for half damage (DC 11). DC = 8 + Con mod + prof • You resist Cold damage Guild Artisan Feature: • While you are in good standing with your guild, your guild can gain you access to powerful politicians Class Features: • Heal 1d10 + level hit points as a bonus action (once between rests) • Fighting Style - Two-Weapon Fighting: Add ability modifier to off-hand damage • Take an extra action once between rests • Fighter Archetype: Eldritch Knight • Form a magical bond with a weapon (see rules) • When unarmed or using monk weapons, can use dex for attack and damage rolls, unarmed strikes deal more damage (d4), and can make an unarmed attack as a bonus action after normal attack action • You gain a reservoir of energy (ki points = monk level) which is restored during a rest • You can use a bonus action and spend 1 ki point to make two unarmed strikes right after using the attack action • You can use a bonus action and spend 1 ki point to Dodge • You can use a bonus action and spend 1 ki point to Dash or Disengage and double the distance you can jump • When you are not in armor or using a shield your speed improves by 10 feet • When you are hit by a ranged weapon attack you can use a reaction to reduce the damage by 1d10 + Dex mod + Monk level, and you can catch and throw the weapon if you would take 0 damage (see rules) • Monk Archetype: Hand • When you hit a creature with a Flurry of Blows attack you can inflict an additional effect (see rules) • You can use a reaction to reduce fall damage by 5 x Monk level • Skilled: You gain three skill or tool proficiencies
notes.armor-proficiencies: Light Armor, Medium Armor, Heavy Armor, Shields
notes.weapon-proficiencies: Simple Weapons, Martial Weapons
notes.special-items: One type of artisan's tools
notes.languages: Common Draconic One Extra Language

notes.features: Human Features: • One extra skill proficiency of your choosing • One bonus feat of your choosing Noble Feature: • You can secure an audience with a local noble • Inspire an ally within 60 feet, giving them a bonus 1d6 on one ability check, attack roll, or save (Cha mod per day) • Durable: You always regain at least 2x Con mod from a hit die and you gain +1 Con Fighter Features: • Fighting Style - Great Weapon Fighting: Reroll 1's and 2's on two-handed melee weapon damage dice • Heal 1d10 + level hit points as a bonus action (once between rests) • Take an extra action once between rests • Fighter Archetype: Knight • Three allies within 60ft heal your level in hp when you second wind • Gain half your proficiency bonus on ability checks you aren't proficient in • You can perform during a short rest to cause any ally or yourself to gain an additional 1d6 hp (once) if healed during the rest • Double proficiency with chosen skills (History,Insight) • Bard Archetype: Valor • You are proficient with martial weapons. medium armor, and shields • Allies can use your Bardic Inspiration on weapon damage rolls and as a reaction to increase their AC against one attack • Tavern Brawler: Your unarmed strikes deal d4 damage, you are proficient in unarmed strikes and improvised weapons, can make a grapple as a bonus action after hitting with one, and +1 to either Str or Con

notes.features: Half-Elf Features: • Within 60 feet of you, treat dim light as bright, darkness as dim light • Immune to magical sleep, advantage on saves vs charmed Urchin Feature: • Your party can travel through a city twice as fast when not in combat Sorcerer Features: • Sorcerer Archetype: Storm • You know Primordial • You can fly 10ft without provoking as a bonus action when you cast a non-cantrip spell • You have a max of 4 sorcery points used to alter spells and regain spell slots • Empowered Spell: You can reroll up to Cha mod damage dice for 1 sorcery point and can use this with other metamagic • Durable: You always regain at least 2x Con mod from a hit die and you gain +1 Con

notes.features: Half-Elf Features: • Within 60 feet of you, treat dim light as bright, darkness as dim light • Immune to magical sleep, advantage on saves vs charmed • Can cast the dancing lights cantrip. At 3rd level, faerie fire (1/day). At 5th level, darkness (1/day) (use Cha for DCs) Cloistered Scholar Feature: • You have information about your cloister and you can use its library. Other libraries are also more likely to admit you. Wizard Features: • Regain half your level (min 1) worth of spell slots during a short rest (once per day) • Wizard Archetype: Evocation • Half gold/time cost to copy school spells • Exclude 1 + spell level creatures from your evocations • Skilled: You gain three skill or tool proficiencies

notes.features: Half-Elf Features: • Within 60 feet of you, treat dim light as bright, darkness as dim light • Immune to magical sleep, advantage on saves vs charmed • Can cast the dancing lights cantrip. At 3rd level, faerie fire (1/day). At 5th level, darkness (1/day) (use Cha for DCs) Urchin Feature: • Your party can travel through a city twice as fast when not in combat Druid Features: • Understand a secret druid language • You can shapeshift into the form of a beast as an action (see rules) • Druid Archetype: Moon • You can wild shape as a bonus action, and can use up a spell slot to regain 1d8 hp per spell slot level as a bonus action while wild shaped • You can wild shape into beasts of CR equal to your druid level/3 (min 1) • Crossbow Expert: You don't have disadvantage from adjacent enemies on ranged attacks, you can load crossbows faster, and you can make a bonus action attack with a hand crossbow after attacking with a one-handed weapon

notes.features: Dwarf Features: • Within 60 feet of you, treat dim light as bright, darkness as dim light • Advantage on saves vs poison, poison damage resistance • Double proficiency bonus to History checks concerning stonework (even if not proficient) • Battleaxe, handaxe, throwing hammer, warhammer proficiency • Gain 1 extra hit point per level Criminal Feature: • You know someone who can connect you with other criminals Rogue Features: • Double proficiency with chosen skills • Sneak Attack (2d6) • Understand a secret language • Double proficiency with chosen skills (Deception,Persuasion) Wizard Features: • Regain half your level (min 1) worth of spell slots during a short rest (once per day) • You can dash, disengage, or hide as a bonus action • Rogue Archetype: Mastermind • You gain fluency with two languages and proficiency with a gaming set, disguise kit, and forger's set • Can make yourself sound like a local • Use help action on targets within 30ft as a bonus action • Magic Initiate: You gain two cantrips and a first level spell which you can cast 1/day from a single spellcasting class • Wizard Archetype: Illusion • Half gold/time cost to copy school spells • You can cast minor illusion, and can have both visual and auditory effects

notes.features: Human Features: • One extra skill proficiency of your choosing • One bonus feat of your choosing Folk Hero Feature: • Commoners are willing to shelter you from some troubles Rogue Features: • Double proficiency with chosen skills • Sneak Attack (3d6) • Understand a secret language • Double proficiency with chosen skills/tools (Sleight of Hand,Thieves' Tools) • Durable: You always regain at least 2x Con mod from a hit die and you gain +1 Con • You can dash, disengage, or hide as a bonus action • Rogue Archetype: Thief • You can use an object, use thieves' tools, or sleight of hand as a Cunning Action • You can climb at full speed and jump Dex mod feet further • Tavern Brawler: Your unarmed strikes deal d4 damage, you are proficient in unarmed strikes and improvised weapons, can make a grapple as a bonus action after hitting with one, and +1 to either Str or Con • You can use a reaction to take half damage when hit by a foe that you see Fighter Features: • Fighting Style - Two-Weapon Fighting: Add ability modifier to off-hand damage • Heal 1d10 + level hit points as a bonus action (once between rests)

notes.features: Goliath Features: • Athletics proficiency • As a reaction, you can reduce damage you would take by 1d12 + Con (1/rest) • You can lift, drag, push, and carry weight as if one size larger • You are adapted to cold climates and high altitudes (see rules) Criminal Feature: • You know someone who can connect you with other criminals Paladin Features: • As an action, detect the location of any celestial, fiend or undead and any consecrated or desecrated place or object within 60 feet (1 + Cha mod per day) • Gain a reservoir of healing power (25hp), and as an action, you can heal a creature you touch by draining that power. You can also cure one poison or disease from the creature by sacrificing 5hp from the reservoir • Fighting Style - Great Weapon Fighting: Reroll 1's and 2's on two-handed melee weapon damage dice • You can sacrifice a spell slot to deal (1 + spell level)d8 radiant damage plus 1d8 extra damage vs undead/fiends, when you hit with a melee weapon attack • Gain immunity to disease • Paladin Archetype: Vengeance • Abjure Enemy: 1 action - Choose one seen creature w/in 60 ft. That creature must make a Wisdom save unless it is immune to being frightened. On a failed save, the target is frightened for 1 minute or until it takes damage. While frightened, target's speed is reduced to 0. On a successful save, target's speed is halved for 1 minute or until it takes damage. • Vow of Enmity: Bonus Action - Choose one seen creature within 10 ft. Your attack rolls against the target have advantage for the next minute or until the creature falls to 0 hp. • War Caster: You gain advantage on concentration vs damage, can still cast while holding weapons, and can cast a single target 1 action spell as an opportunity attack • You can make two attacks on your turn

notes.features: Dragonborn Features: • Brass Dragon • You can breathe a 30 ft line of Fire(once between rests), dealing 2d6 Fire damage, Dex save for half damage (DC 11). DC = 8 + Con mod + prof • You resist Fire damage Soldier Feature: • You have influence within your former army/organization Class Features: • Add Wis mod to AC when not wearing armor or using a shield • When unarmed or using monk weapons, can use dex for attack and damage rolls, unarmed strikes deal more damage (d4), and can make an unarmed attack as a bonus action after normal attack action • You gain a reservoir of energy (ki points = monk level) which is restored during a rest • You can use a bonus action and spend 1 ki point to make two unarmed strikes right after using the attack action • You can use a bonus action and spend 1 ki point to Dodge • You can use a bonus action and spend 1 ki point to Dash or Disengage and double the distance you can jump • When you are not in armor or using a shield your speed improves by 10 feet • When you are hit by a ranged weapon attack you can use a reaction to reduce the damage by 1d10 + Dex mod + Monk level, and you can catch and throw the weapon if you would take 0 damage (see rules) • Monk Archetype: Hand • When you hit a creature with a Flurry of Blows attack you can inflict an additional effect (see rules) • You can use a reaction to reduce fall damage by 5 x Monk level • Resilient: You gain proficiency with one save and +1 to that ability

notes.equiptment: quarterstaff ten darts explorer's pack rank insignia trophy set of bone dice set of common clothes belt pouch

notes.features: Dwarf Features: • Within 60 feet of you, treat dim light as bright, darkness as dim light • Advantage on saves vs poison, poison damage resistance • Double proficiency bonus to History checks concerning stonework (even if not proficient) • Battleaxe, handaxe, throwing hammer, warhammer proficiency • Gain 1 extra hit point per level Acolyte Feature: • Receive aid from those who share your faith Cleric Features: • Cleric Archetype: Forge • Proficiency Heavy Armor, Smith's Tools • You can make a nonmagical weapon or armor a +1 magic item until you die or take a long rest, once after a long rest • Inspire an ally within 60 feet, giving them a bonus 1d6 on one ability check, attack roll, or save (Cha mod per day) • Turn Undead (see rules) • Artisan's Blessing (see rules) • Squat Nimbleness: You have advantage on grapple escape attempts, +5 feet to speed, gain Athletics or Acrobatics proficiency, and +1 Str or Dex • Gain half your proficiency bonus on ability checks you aren't proficient in • You can perform during a short rest to cause any ally or yourself to gain an additional 1d6 hp (once) if healed during the rest • Double proficiency with chosen skills (Insight,Religion) • Bard Archetype: Lore • You are proficient in three additional skills • You can spend a use of Bardic Inspiration as a reaction to give a creature within 60 feet a penalty on an attack roll, damage roll, or ability check

notes.features: Human Features: • One extra skill proficiency of your choosing • One bonus feat of your choosing Haunted One Feature: • Commoners will do what they can to help you Wizard Features: • Regain half your level (min 1) worth of spell slots during a short rest (once per day) • Prodigy: You gain one language, one skill proficiency, one skill double proficiency, and one tool proficiency • Double proficiency with chosen skills (Arcana) Warlock Features: • Warlock Archetype: Old One • The spells dissonant whispers and hideous laughter are added to the warlock spell list for you • You can telepathically communicate with any creature that knows any language within 30 feet • Wizard Archetype: Transmutation • Half gold/time cost to copy school spells • You can alter the composition of objects (see rules) • War Caster: You gain advantage on concentration vs damage, can still cast while holding weapons, and can cast a single target 1 action spell as an opportunity attack • Forceful Cantrip: You can push creatures you hit with eldritch blast ten feet • Mage Armor Expert: You don't use a spell slot when casting mage armor on yourself • Tome: You can cast three cantrips from any class (see rules) • The spells detect thoughts and phantasmal force are added to the warlock spell list for you • Resilient: You gain proficiency with one save and +1 to that ability

notes.weapon-proficiencies: Daggers, Darts, Slings, Quarterstaffs, Light Crossbows Simple Weapons
notes.special-items: One tool proficiency
notes.languages: Common Extra Language One Exotic Language One extra language

notes.features: Human Features: • One extra skill proficiency of your choosing • One bonus feat of your choosing Haunted One Feature: • Commoners will do what they can to help you Wizard Features: • Regain half your level (min 1) worth of spell slots during a short rest (once per day) • Elemental Adept: Your spells that deal one of acid/cold/fire/lightning/thunder ignore resistance, and you can treat rolled 1s as 2s for those spells Warlock Features: • Warlock Archetype: Undead • The spells false life and ray of sickness are added to the warlock spell list for you • You know spare the dying • You repel attacks by undead (see rules) • Wizard Archetype: Evocation • Half gold/time cost to copy school spells • Exclude 1 + spell level creatures from your evocations • Grasping Eldritch Blast: Your eldritch blast can pull targets 10 feet • Mage Armor Expert: You don't use a spell slot when casting mage armor on yourself • War Caster: You gain advantage on concentration vs damage, can still cast while holding weapons, and can cast a single target 1 action spell as an opportunity attack • Tome: You can cast three cantrips from any class (see rules) • The spells blindness/deafness and silence are added to the warlock spell list for you • Resilient: You gain proficiency with one save and +1 to that ability • Your cantrips deal half damage on a save

notes.weapon-proficiencies: Daggers, Darts, Slings, Quarterstaffs, Light Crossbows Simple Weapons

notes.equiptment: dagger arcane focus scholar's pack spellbook set of common clothes monster hunter's pack important trinket

notes.features: Elf Features: • Within 120 feet of you, treat dim light as bright, darkness as dim light • Immune to magical sleep, advantage on saves vs charmed • Meditating 4 hours counts as 8 hours of rest • Perception proficiency • While in direct sunlight, you have disadvantage on attack rolls and perception checks • Can cast the dancing lights cantrip. At 3rd level, faerie fire (1/day). At 5th level, darkness (1/day) (use Cha for DCs) • Rapier, shortsword, and hand crossbow proficiency Criminal Feature: • You know someone who can connect you with other criminals Rogue Features: • Double proficiency with chosen skills • Sneak Attack (1d6) • Understand a secret language • Double proficiency with chosen skills (Deception,Stealth) • You can dash, disengage, or hide as a bonus action • Rogue Archetype: Arcane Trickster • Special abilities with mage hand (see rules) • Dark Elf Magic: 1/day you can cast dispel magic and levitate, and can at will cast detect magic Warlock Features: • Warlock Archetype: Hexblade • The spells shield and wrathful smite are added to the warlock spell list for you • 1/rest as a bonus action you can curse a creature for 1 minute, healing level + Cha mod hp when it dies, critting it on a 19, and dealing it proficiency bonus extra damage • Gain martial weapon, shield, and medium armor proficiency • You can use Charisma for attack and damage rolls with your pact weapons and one one-handed weapon you choose at the start of each day • Disguise Self Expert: You don't use a spell slot when casting disguise self • Potent Cantrip: Your eldritch blast does Cha mod extra damage • Blade: You gain the ability to conjure a magical weapon (see rules) • The spells blur and branding smite are added to the warlock spell list for you • Elven Accuracy: You can reroll a Dex, Int, Wis, or Cha attack, and +1 Dex, Int, Wis, or Cha • You can use a reaction to take half damage when hit by a foe that you see • Double proficiency with chosen skills (Athletics,Intimidation)

notes.weapon-proficiencies: Rapier Shortsword Hand Crossbow Simple Weapons, Hand Crossbows, Longswords, Rapiers, Shortswords Simple Weapons Martial Weapons

notes.features: Tabaxi Features: • Within 60 feet of you, treat dim light as bright, darkness as dim light • You can double your speed for a turn when you move but must spend a turn not moving before using this again • You can claw as an unarmed attack for 1d4 slashing damage and can climb with a 20 speed Barbarian Tribe Member Feature: • You can forage for twice as much food and water while in the wilderness and have knowledge of barbarian lands Fighter Features: • Fighting Style - Archery: +2 to attack with ranged weapons • Heal 1d10 + level hit points as a bonus action (once between rests) • Take an extra action once between rests • Fighter Archetype: Battle Master • Gain four superiority dice (d8) to spend on maneuvers • One artisan's tools proficiency • Riposte: You can use a reaction when missed by a melee attack to make a melee attack back and deal Superiority Die extra damage • Lunge: You can cause your next melee attack to have 5 extra feet of range and deal Superiority Die extra damage • Evade: You can gain Superiority Die to AC while moving • Martial Adept: You gain a superiority die and two battle master maneuvers • Cleave: You can cause one creature adjacent to one you hit with a melee weapon to take Superiority Die damage if the same attack roll would hit • Feint: You can spend a bonus action to grant your next attack against an adjacent foe advantage and Superiority Die extra damage

notes.weapon-proficiencies: Simple Weapons, Martial Weapons

notes.languages: Common Extra Language One Extra Language

notes.features: Halfling Features: • Can reroll a natural 1 • Advantage on saves vs frightened • Can move through larger creatures' spaces • Can hide while obscured by larger creatures Entertainer Feature: • Your performances tend to make people like you, and you can always find somewhere to perform • Inspire an ally within 60 feet, giving them a bonus 1d6 on one ability check, attack roll, or save (Cha mod per day) Cleric Features: • Cleric Archetype: Trickery • You can touch an ally as an action to grant it advantage on stealth checks for one hour or until you use this ability again • Gain half your proficiency bonus on ability checks you aren't proficient in • You can perform during a short rest to cause any ally or yourself to gain an additional 1d6 hp (once) if healed during the rest • Turn Undead (see rules) • Invoke Duplicity (see rules) • Double proficiency with chosen skills (Performance,Stealth) • Bard Archetype: Glamour • You can spend a use of Bardic Inspiration as a bonus action to allow Cha mod creatures within 60 feet that can see you to move their speed without provoking as a reaction and grant them 5 temp hp (see rules) • Once per rest you can attempt to charm up to Cha mod creatures in your audience (see rules) • Tough: You gain 2 extra hp per level

notes.weapon-proficiencies: Simple Weapons, Hand Crossbows, Longswords, Rapiers, Shortswords

notes.features: • Fighting Style - Two-Weapon Fighting: Add ability modifier to off-hand damage • Take an extra action once between rests • Fighter Archetype: Battle Master • Gain four superiority dice (d8) to spend on maneuvers • One artisan's tools proficiency • Distract: You can cause one creature you hit to take Superiority Die extra damage and grant advantage to the next attack against it this round from someone else • Parry: You can use a reaction to take Superiority Die + Dex mod less damage from a melee attack • Riposte: You can use a reaction when missed by a melee attack to make a melee attack back and deal Superiority Die extra damage • Dual Wielder: You can draw/stow two weapons per round, you can dual wield non-light weapons, and you gain +1 AC while dual wielding • You can make two attacks on your turn
notes.special-items: One type of artisan's tools
notes.equiptment: chain mail

notes.features: Dragonborn Features: • Silver Dragon • You can breathe a 15 ft cone of cold (once between rests), dealing 2d6 cold damage, Dex save for half damage. DC = 8 + Con mod + prof • You resist cold damage Entertainer Feature: • Your performances tend to make people like you, and you can always find somewhere to perform • Inspire an ally within 60 feet, giving them a bonus 1d6 on one ability check, attack roll, or save (Cha mod per day) Barbarian Features: • 2/day you gain advantage on Str checks and saves, deal +2 damage on strength based melee attacks, and resistance vs bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage • Add Con mod to AC when not wearing armor • Gain half your proficiency bonus on ability checks you aren't proficient in • You can perform during a short rest to cause any ally or yourself to gain an additional 1d6 hp (once) if healed during the rest • Double proficiency with chosen skills (Acrobatics,Performance) • Bard Archetype: Valor • You are proficient with martial weapons. medium armor, and shields • Allies can use your Bardic Inspiration on weapon damage rolls and as a reaction to increase their AC against one attack • You can gain advantage on Str based melee attacks by granting advantage to attacks against you for the round • You gain advantage on Dex saves vs things you can see • Actor: You gain advantage on deception and performance checks to impersonate someone else, you can imitate the sounds or speech of another creature, and you gain +1 Cha

notes.features: Half-Elf Features: • Within 60 feet of you, treat dim light as bright, darkness as dim light • Immune to magical sleep, advantage on saves vs charmed • Two extra skill proficiencies of your choosing Cloistered Scholar Feature: • You have information about your cloister and you can use its library. Other libraries are also more likely to admit you. Bard Features: • Inspire an ally within 60 feet, giving them a bonus 1d6 on one ability check, attack roll, or save (Cha mod per day) • Gain half your proficiency bonus on ability checks you aren't proficient in • You can perform during a short rest to cause any ally or yourself to gain an additional 1d6 hp (once) if healed during the rest • Double proficiency with chosen skills (History,Performance) • Bard Archetype: Lore • You are proficient in three additional skills • You can spend a use of Bardic Inspiration as a reaction to give a creature within 60 feet a penalty on an attack roll, damage roll, or ability check • Spell Sniper: Your spells ignore ½ and ¾ cover, your ranged attack roll spells have doubled range, and you gain one attack roll cantrip (see rules)

notes.features: Human Features: • One extra skill proficiency of your choosing • One bonus feat of your choosing Entertainer Feature: • Your performances tend to make people like you, and you can always find somewhere to perform Class Features: • Inspire an ally within 60 feet, giving them a bonus 1d6 on one ability check, attack roll, or save (Cha mod per day) • Lucky: You can reroll a d20 roll you make or an attack against you 3/day • Heal 1d10 + level hit points as a bonus action (once between rests) • Fighting Style - Dueling: +2 damage when using a single one-handed weapon • Gain half your proficiency bonus on ability checks you aren't proficient in • Song of Rest: You can perform during a short rest to cause any ally or yourself to gain an additional 1d6 hp (once) if healed during the rest • Bard Archetype: Lore • You are proficient in three additional skills • You can spend a use of Bardic Inspiration as a reaction to give a creature within 60 feet a penalty on an attack roll, damage roll, or ability check Double proficiency with chosen skills (Acrobatics, Sleight of Hand, Insight, Performance) • Take an extra action once between rests • Fighter Archetype: Champion • Crit on 19 • Skilled: You gain three skill or tool proficiencies • Inspiration improves to d8 • Regain Bardic Inspiration with short rest • You can perform as an action to give yourself and allies who can hear you advantage on saves vs charm and frightened for one round • You can learn two more spells from any class • Weapon Master: You gain four weapon proficiencies and +1 to either Str or Dex • Mobile: You gain +10 to speed, ignore difficult terrain when you dash, and you don't provoke from creatures you've attacked that turn • Rest healing bonus improves to 1d8 • Inspiration improves to d10 • Two additional double proficient skills • You can learn two spells from any class • You can make two attacks on your turn

notes.features: Dragonborn Features: • Bronze Dragon • You can breathe a 30 ft line of Lightning(once between rests), dealing 4d6 Lightning damage, Dex save for half damage (DC 14). DC = 8 + Con mod + prof • You resist Lightning damage Soldier Feature: • You have influence within your former army/organization Class Features: • Cleric Archetype: Knowledge • Two extra languages, two knowledge skills with double proficiency bonus • Turn Undead (see rules) • Knowledge of the Ages (see rules) • Dual Wielder: You can draw/stow two weapons per round, you can dual wield non-light weapons, and you gain +1 AC while dual wielding • When unarmed or using monk weapons, can use dex for attack and damage rolls, unarmed strikes deal more damage (d4), and can make an unarmed attack as a bonus action after normal attack action • You gain a reservoir of energy (ki points = monk level) which is restored during a rest • You can use a bonus action and spend 1 ki point to make two unarmed strikes right after using the attack action • You can use a bonus action and spend 1 ki point to Dodge • You can use a bonus action and spend 1 ki point to Dash or Disengage and double the distance you can jump • When you are not in armor or using a shield your speed improves by 10 feet • When you are hit by a ranged weapon attack you can use a reaction to reduce the damage by 1d10 + Dex mod + Monk level, and you can catch and throw the weapon if you would take 0 damage (see rules) • Monk Archetype: Light • You can make a spell attack with 30ft range and radiant damage equal to your unarmed strike. When you use this attack you can expend a ki point and bonus action to repeat the attack twice • Kill CR ½ undead that fail save vs turning • Additional divinity per rest • Read Thoughts (see rules) • CR 1 undead can now be killed • Cleric cantrips deal Wis mod extra damage • Durable: You always regain at least 2x Con mod from a hit die and you gain +1 Con • You can use a reaction to reduce fall damage by 5 x Monk level
